name: General Chemistry I
description: This course provides a comprehensive study of the fundamental principles and laws of chemistry, including atomic structure, chemical bonding, stoichiometry, states of matter, solutions, acids and bases, and equilibrium.

name: General Chemistry II
description: This course is a continuation of General Chemistry I and provides a comprehensive study of chemical thermodynamics, acid-base equilibrium, electrochemistry, quantum mechanics, and periodic properties.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: This course is an introduction to inorganic chemistry, including chemical bonding, symmetry, molecular orbital theory, coordination chemistry, solid state chemistry, and descriptive chemistry of the elements.

name: Physical Chemistry I
description: This course provides a comprehensive study of thermodynamics, including energy, work, heat, enthalpy, entropy, and free energy.

name: Instrumental Methods of Analysis
description: This course is an introduction to the modern analytical techniques used in chemistry, including spectroscopy, chromatography, and electrochemistry.

name: Inorganic Synthesis
description: This course is an introduction to the synthesis and manipulation of inorganic compounds, including organometallics and bioinorganic compounds.

name: Physical Chemistry II
description: This course provides a comprehensive study of quantum mechanics, including wave-particle duality, the Schr√∂dinger equation, the hydrogen atom, and molecular orbital theory.
